content.p: Decide whether the statement is describing the conducting zone or the respiratory zone of the respiratory tract.

body.p: Responsible for warming and humidifying air entering the body.

response.name: conducting_zone
response.feedback: Correct. The conducting zone is responsible for warming and humidifying the air before the air reaches the delicate respiratory zone. If the the temperature is too far below body temperature it can damage the alveoli.

response.name: respiratory_zone
response.feedback: Incorrect. The respiratory zone is very delicate and can be damaged if the air is too cold when it reaches it. The enzymes of the respiratory zone also require the temperature to be near body temperature, so the needs to be warmed before arriving here.

content.p: Decide whether the statement is describing the conducting zone or the respiratory zone of the respiratory tract.

body.p: Allows for the passage of air from inside the body to outside the body.

response.name: conducting_zone
response.feedback: Correct. The conducting zone extends from the mouth and the nose to the large passages of the bronchial tree. These tubes allow for the passage of air from the atmosphere into the lungs.

response.name: respiratory_zone
response.feedback: Incorrect. The respiratory zone includes the terminal bronchioles and the alveoli and is responsible for gas exchange not transport in and out of the body.

content.p: Decide whether the statement is describing the conducting zone or the respiratory zone of the respiratory tract.

body.p: Contains ciliated cells but does not contain goblet cells.

response.name: conducting_zone
response.feedback: Incorrect. The conducting zone contains both ciliate cells and goblet cells. The mucus produced by the goblet cells allows particles to be caught and the cilia move the particles up out of the lungs.

response.name: respiratory_zone
response.feedback: Correct. The respiratory zone has ciliate cells but does not contain any mucus producing goblet cells. The respiratory zone needs to allow for efficient diffusion and mucus would decrease the diffusion rate.

content.p: Decide whether the statement is describing the conducting zone or the respiratory zone of the respiratory tract.

body.p: As a surface area of about 27 square meters.

response.name: conducting_zone
response.feedback: Incorrect. The conducting zone does not need to have a large surface area because it is only providing a pathway for the air to move into the lungs.

response.name: respiratory_zone
response.feedback: Correct. The respiratory zone has a large surface area to promote diffusion of gasses between the lungs and the blood. The larger surface area allows for more efficient diffusion.

content.p: Decide whether the statement is describing the conducting zone or the respiratory zone of the respiratory tract.

body.p: Allows for gas exchange between the lungs and the blood.

response.name: conducting_zone
response.feedback: Incorrect. The conducting zone provides a conduit or a passageway to the lungs but no gas exchange occurs here.

response.name: respiratory_zone
response.feedback: Correct. The respiratory zone consisting of the alveoli and terminal bronchioles is the location of gas exchange.

content.p: Decide whether the statement is describing the conducting zone or the respiratory zone of the respiratory tract.

response.name: conducting_zone
response.feedback: Correct. The conducting zone contains ciliated and goblet cells that produce the mucociliary elevator that moves mucus and the particles trapped in it up and out of the lungs.

response.name: respiratory_zone
response.feedback: Incorrect. The respiratory zone contains cells that are ciliated but does not contain any mucus producing cells.
